result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Amber L Horst was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Original filed in 14CF257
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Amber L Horst in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Amber L Horst in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 13CF469 and 14CF257 for sentencing; 14TR2547 Pre-Trial Conference.

8:32 a.m. Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Sheets does not have any corrections to the PSI.
Court questions Atty Sheets if he would like additional time to review the PSI with his client and would re-schedule sentencing.
Atty Sheets and his client are ready to proceed to sentencing.
Atty Molepske has correction on Page 1.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Court interrupts and indicates that the 13CM408 case had been dismissed outright, Atty Sheets agrees; Atty Molepske retracts his statement regarding this case.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to her sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
13CF469:
Count 1 - Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

Count 2 - 
Impose prison sentence of 3.5 years with 18 months initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision
Jail credit of 67 days
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program 
Impose fine of $600 + costs totalling $1,494.00 
Pay $33.33 blood draw fee
36 month DL revocation
36 month IID effective on any vehicles owned or operated by defendant
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
Maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.
Obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and provide agent with copies of all prescriptions.
Provide DNA sample if not already 

Count 3 - DRI

14CF257:
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 -
Impose prison sentence of 5.5 years with 30 months of initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision; Concurrent to 13CF469
Eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program 
Jail credit for 202 days 
Impose fine of $600 + costs with DNA surcharge totalling $1,744.00
Pay $33.33 Blood draw fee
36 month revocation of DL
36 month IID on any vehicles owned/operated by defendant
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
Follow same conditions as imposed on 13CF349

**Any bond monies posted to be applied to Fines/Costs 

Count 3 - Dismissed on Prosecutor's Motion

14TR2547:
Dismissed on Motion of the State
Pre-Trial Supervision Program Report
Sentencing hearing on January 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Amber L Horst in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Defendant Amber L Horst in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are: 13CF-469, 13CM-408 and 14CF-257.

1:56 PM Court calls cases.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

There is a plea agreement:
13CM-408: Dismissed
13CF-469: Defendant will plead to Count 2. 2 yrs initial, 2 yrs extended supervision, imposed/stayed prison, $600 fine, $33.33 blood draw fee, 36 mo iid, 36 mo rev, aoda, abs sob, other counseling, no prescription drugs w/o valid prescription, supply agent list of all prescriptions
14CF-257: Defendant will plead to Count 2. BAC :.124 2 1/2 yrs initial, 3 yrs extended supervision, imposed/stayed prison, $600 fine, $33.33 blood draw fee, 36 mo iid, 36 mo rev, comply with 14CM-469, concurrent to 14CM-469

State has complied with vicitm notification statutes.

Atty Sheets concurs, clarifies with agreement.
Atty Sheets believes a PSI is not necessary today and feels comfortable proceeding today.
Parties have received a copy of the ATTIC report.

Defendant concurs with the agreement.

 Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 13CF-469 Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST 14CF-257 Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Sheets for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CM-408 Dismiss
13CF-469 Count 1 Dismiss
13CF-469 Count 2 BAC 5th offense
13CF-469 Count 3 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-257 Count 1 Dismiss and Read In
14CF-257 Count 2 BAC 6th offense
14CF-257 Count 3 Dismissed

Atty Sheets is prepared to continue to sentencing.
Atty Molepske addresses one concern.

Court is going to order a PSI due to the severity of the offenses and the ATTIC report findings.

BY THE COURT:
Court orders a PSI.
PSI to be completed and provided to the parties at least one week prior to sentencing hearing.

Atty Sheets is recommending to revoke the bond.

BY THE COURT:
Court will revoke bonds and money will be held for any fine/costs.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
